revised_title: Investigating the Magnetic Phenomena Produced by Electricity and the Conducting Powers of Electrified Bodies
tldr: Humphry Davy investigates the magnetic phenomena produced by electricity and the conducting powers of electrified bodies. He discovers that imperfect conducting fluids do not give polarity to steel when electricity is passed through them, and that voltaic current in air is affected by the magnet. Additionally, he finds that the conducting power of metallic bodies varies with temperature, decreasing as the temperature increases.
